name: Lance Bangs
bio:
Lance Bangs is a filmmaker, documentarian, and music video director.

His comedy work includes directing David Cross's film Let America Laugh, as well as standup specials for Marc Maron, John Hodgman, Nick Thune, Todd Barry and Rob Delaney. Bangs has also been heavily involved in the filming and production of MTVâ€™s Jackass television series and its subsequent movies. He was the Executive Producer of the Adult Swim series "Loiter Squad" and recently directed "The Greatest Event in Television History" with Adam Scott.

He directed the second season of the Comedy Central series "The Meltdown with Jonah Ray and Kumail Nanjiani" and the 2016 Viceland series "Flophouse."
